com.percussion.security
Interface IPSPasswordFilter

All Superinterfaces:
IPSExtension
All Known Implementing Classes:
DefaultPasswordFilter
public interface IPSPasswordFilter
extends IPSExtension

IPSPasswordFilter is an interface to password encryption. Often when passwords are stored (in a file, database, or wherever), they are first encrypted. When authentication occurs, the password that is entered by the user is encrypted by the same process and the encrypted versions are compared byte-for-byte. IMPORTANT: Implementing classes are required to provide a meaningful no-arguments constructor that will produce a working filter.

Methods inherited from interface com.percussion.extension.IPSExtension
init
 

Method Detail

encrypt

String encrypt(String password)
This method is called by the Rhythmyx security provider before authenticating a user. The password submitted in the request is run through this filter, then checked against the stored password character-for-character.

Parameters:
password - The clear-text password to be encrypted. Never null.
Returns:
A string containing the encrypted password. Never null.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - If any param is invalid.
